name: CLI Basics
description: Before diving into the CTF challenges, make sure you're comfortable with basic command line operations.

learning_steps.title: Linux Commands Cheat Sheet
learning_steps.description: Familiarize yourself with common commands like ls, cd, pwd, cat, grep, find, and more.
Open your terminal and practice these essential commands:
learning_steps.code:
# Print working directory
pwd

# List files
ls -la

# Change directory
cd ~/l2c

# Create a directory
mkdir test-folder

# Create a file
touch test-file.txt

# View file contents
cat test-file.txt

learning_steps.title: Understanding Linux File Permissions
learning_steps.description: Understanding permissions (chmod, chown) is essential for Linux administration.
Learn how to chain commands together:
learning_steps.code:
# Pipe output to another command
ls -la | grep ".txt"

# Redirect output to a file
echo "Hello World" > hello.txt

# Append to a file
echo "Another line" >> hello.txt

# View file contents
cat hello.txt

questions.prompt: Explain what the ls, cd, and pwd commands do in Linux.
What are file permissions in Linux and what do the read, write, and execute permissions mean?

test_knowledge_prompts: Can you quiz me on basic Linux navigation commands like ls, cd, and pwd?
Can you ask me how file permissions work in Linux?
Can you ask me to explain what pipes and redirects do?

checklist.text: I can navigate the file system using cd, ls, and pwd
I can create and view files using touch, cat, and echo
I can use pipes and redirects
